content.description: Sit start deep down in the cave on the detached flake with feet pushing from the main boulder. From there, follow the massive flake out the cave, mantel onto it, and finish up the remaining arete-slab.
content.protection: Three pads worked well for me. For the most part, the landing is good.
content.location: Climb the cave on the boulder's west side.

content.description: Sit start with a left hand undercling and a right hand dimple-edge. From there, gain the jug rail above, follow to a right hand edge, then a left hand sidepull-pinch, reach the lip and features on top, and mantel onto the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is shared with a rock that presents some unevenness.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Kitty Hawk.

content.description: Sit start with a right hand edge and a left hand sidepull. From there, slap into a jug rail, follow that rail around the south arete, use an edge to gain the slab, and mantel atop the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing is good, but there is a section that has rock.
content.location: It climbs the east and south face of Kitty Hawk.

content.description: Sit start with a right hand edge and a left hand sidepull. From there, gain a right hand edge at the shelf, follow to a left hand edge, then traverse right along the sloping shelf to a jug and a good foot, pop up to the lip, and mantel onto the boulder.
content.protection: A pair of pads. The landing has a few rocks smattered along the traverse.
content.location: It climbs the east face of Kitty Hawk.
